verses.kjv: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:
verses.ct: When you sit down to eat with a powerful person, pay careful attention to what's in front of you.

verses.kjv: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.
verses.ct: Restrain yourself — put a knife to your own throat if you're someone who struggles with appetite.

verses.kjv: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.
verses.ct: Don't crave his fine food, because it comes with hidden strings attached.

verses.kjv: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.
verses.ct: Don't exhaust yourself trying to get rich; have the sense to stop.

verses.kjv: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.
verses.ct: Why would you chase after something that vanishes? Wealth sprouts wings and flies off like an eagle soaring into the heavens.

verses.kjv: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:
verses.ct: Don't eat the food of a stingy person, and don't crave his fine dishes.

verses.kjv: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.
verses.ct: Because he's always calculating the cost in his mind — that's who he really is. He tells you, 'Go ahead, eat and drink,' but he doesn't mean it.

verses.kjv: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.
verses.ct: You'll end up throwing up the little bit you ate, and your kind words to him will have been completely wasted.

verses.kjv: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.
verses.ct: Don't bother trying to reason with a fool, because he'll only look down on the wisdom you offer.

verses.kjv: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:
verses.ct: Don't move ancient boundary markers, and don't encroach on the land that belongs to orphans.

verses.kjv: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.
verses.ct: Their Defender is powerful, and he will take up their case against you.

verses.kjv: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.
verses.ct: Commit yourself to learning, and open your ears to words of knowledge.

verses.kjv: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.
verses.ct: Don't hold back discipline from a child — if you correct him with a rod, it won't kill him.

verses.kjv: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.
verses.ct: Correct him with the rod, and you will rescue his soul from death.

verses.kjv: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.
verses.ct: My son, if your heart grows wise, then my own heart will celebrate.

verses.kjv: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.
verses.ct: My whole being will be glad when your lips speak what is right.

verses.kjv: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long.
verses.ct: Don't let your heart be jealous of sinners; instead, maintain wholehearted dedication to the LORD every single day.

verses.kjv: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.
verses.ct: There is certainly a future ahead, and your hope will not be disappointed.

verses.kjv: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.
verses.ct: Listen, my son, and become wise — keep your heart directed on the right path.

verses.kjv: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:
verses.ct: Don't hang around heavy drinkers or people who gorge themselves on food.

verses.kjv: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.
verses.ct: Because drunkards and gluttons will end up in poverty, and their laziness will dress them in rags.

verses.kjv: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.
verses.ct: Listen to your father who gave you life, and don't look down on your mother when she gets old.

verses.kjv: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.
verses.ct: Acquire truth and never let it go — along with wisdom, discipline, and understanding.

verses.kjv: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.
verses.ct: The father of a righteous person has great reason to celebrate; whoever becomes the father of a wise child will find deep joy in them.

verses.kjv: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.
verses.ct: Let your father and mother be proud of you; let the woman who gave birth to you celebrate.

verses.kjv: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.
verses.ct: My son, give me your full attention, and let your eyes follow the path I walk.

verses.kjv: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.
verses.ct: A prostitute is like a deep pit, and an immoral woman is like a narrow trap.

verses.kjv: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.
verses.ct: She hides and waits like a predator, and she increases the number of unfaithful men.

verses.kjv: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?
verses.ct: Who suffers misery? Who has grief? Who gets into fights? Who won't stop complaining? Who gets hurt for no reason? Who has bloodshot eyes?

verses.kjv: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.
verses.ct: Those who linger over their wine — those who go searching for mixed drinks.

verses.kjv: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.
verses.ct: Don't be captivated by wine's red color, the way it sparkles in the cup, or how smoothly it goes down.

verses.kjv: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.
verses.ct: In the end, it strikes like a snake and poisons like a viper.

verses.kjv: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.
verses.ct: Your eyes will see things that aren't there, and your mind will say twisted things.

verses.kjv: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.
verses.ct: You'll feel like you're lying down in the middle of the ocean, or swaying on top of a ship's mast.

verses.kjv: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.
verses.ct: You'll say, 'They hit me, but I didn't feel any pain; they beat me, but I don't remember it. When will I wake up? I need another drink.'
